Part 2: Tapered Cylindrical Object Second, create a new coordinate system with Euler angles [-90, 0, -90] and a translation vector [0.317, 0.5644, 0]. Draw a 2D sketch on the YZ plane. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the Euler angles [-90, 0, -90] and the translation vector [0.317, 0.5644, 0]. Part 3: Cylindrical Object with a Hole Finally, create a new coordinate system with Euler angles [90, 0, -90] and a translation vector [0.0077, 0.699, 0.051]. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the Euler angles [90, 0, -90] and the translation vector [0.0077, 0.699, 0.051]. Lastly, extrude the sketch with a normal depth of 0 and an opposite normal depth of 0.5567. Our final shape will be a cylindrical object with a hole, as described in its attributes. With these instruction sequences, you can generate accurate parametrized CAD models based on the given JSON data. Make sure to cross-check the parts after each step to ensure correctness.</description>
